headline.print_headline: U.S. Denies Protections for Wolverines, Outrages Conservationists
headline.main: U.S. Denies Protections for Wolverines, Outrages Conservationists

docs.snippet: U.S. wildlife managers on Tuesday denied federal protections for rare wolverines, outraging conservationists but pleasing Western states that opposed adding the reclusive but feisty member of the weasel family to the endangered and threatened spec...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. wildlife managers on Tuesday denied federal protections for rare wolverines, outraging conservationists but pleasing Western states that opposed adding the reclusive but feisty member of the weasel family to the endangered and threatened species list.

headline.print_headline: Stewart's Lethal Accident Could Cause NASCAR Sponsors to Rethink Deals
headline.main: Stewart's Lethal Accident Could Cause NASCAR Sponsors to Rethink Deals

docs.snippet: NASCAR driver Tony Stewart's involvement in a fatal on-track accident over the weekend may wave a caution flag for the big-money corporate sponsors backing the three-time champion's team, industry analysts said....
docs.lead_paragraph: NASCAR driver Tony Stewart's involvement in a fatal on-track accident over the weekend may wave a caution flag for the big-money corporate sponsors backing the three-time champion's team, industry analysts said.

headline.sub: Stocks slip; Kate Spade shares mauled
headline.main: Stocks slip; Kate Spade shares mauled

docs.snippet: Summary: U.S. stocks dip with investors skeptical about Russian movement toward Ukraine; Kate Spade shares slump 25 percent after margin warning; King Digital sales, outlook anything but sweet. Conway G. Gittens reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: Summary: U.S. stocks dip with investors skeptical about Russian movement toward Ukraine; Kate Spade shares slump 25 percent after margin warning; King Digital sales, outlook anything but sweet. Conway G. Gittens reports.

headline.print_headline: Pope's South Korea Trip Gives Opportunity to Reach Out to China
headline.main: Pope's South Korea Trip Gives Opportunity to Reach Out to China

docs.snippet: On his way to South Korea, Pope Francis will get a rare opportunity to directly address China's leadership as he flies over the country, whose communist government does not allow Catholics to recognize his authority....
docs.lead_paragraph: On his way to South Korea, Pope Francis will get a rare opportunity to directly address China's leadership as he flies over the country, whose communist government does not allow Catholics to recognize his authority.

headline.print_headline: New Road Makes Trip to Grand Canyon Skywalk Faster
headline.main: New Road Makes Trip to Grand Canyon Skywalk Faster

docs.snippet: Officials from the Hualapai Tribe gathered Tuesday for a ceremonial grand opening of a road that had been a major headache for tourists headed to the Grand Canyon Skywalk....
docs.lead_paragraph: Officials from the Hualapai Tribe gathered Tuesday for a ceremonial grand opening of a road that had been a major headache for tourists headed to the Grand Canyon Skywalk.

headline.print_headline: Selig Eager to Step Aside and Introduce Successor
headline.main: Selig Eager to Step Aside and Introduce Successor

docs.snippet: Major League Baseball Commissioner Bud Selig is looking forward to writing a book, teaching history and relaxing when he retires this winter....
docs.lead_paragraph: Major League Baseball Commissioner Bud Selig is looking forward to writing a book, teaching history and relaxing when he retires this winter.

headline.print_headline: Times Square's Costumed Superheroes Fight Back Against Bad Press
headline.main: Times Square's Costumed Superheroes Fight Back Against Bad Press

docs.snippet: After a spate of arrests and bad publicity, the costumed characters who pose for tourist photographs in New York's Times Square in the hopes of a cash tip have formed an association to preserve a livelihood that has come under increasing scrutiny....
docs.lead_paragraph: After a spate of arrests and bad publicity, the costumed characters who pose for tourist photographs in New York's Times Square in the hopes of a cash tip have formed an association to preserve a livelihood that has come under increasing scrutiny.

headline.print_headline: Gunman Gets 18-30 Years for Demarius Reed Slaying
headline.main: Gunman Gets 18-30 Years for Demarius Reed Slaying

docs.snippet: A man who confessed to robbing and killing Eastern Michigan University wide receiver Demarius Reed has been sentenced to 18 to 30 years in prison....
docs.lead_paragraph: A man who confessed to robbing and killing Eastern Michigan University wide receiver Demarius Reed has been sentenced to 18 to 30 years in prison.

headline.print_headline: New Hampshire Man Convicted of Killing Teen to Appear at Sentencing
headline.main: New Hampshire Man Convicted of Killing Teen to Appear at Sentencing

docs.snippet: A New Hampshire man found guilty last month of murdering a 19-year-old female college student has dropped his request to not appear at his sentencing hearing on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A New Hampshire man found guilty last month of murdering a 19-year-old female college student has dropped his request to not appear at his sentencing hearing on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Education Aide to Pennsylvania Governor Resigns Amid Controversy
headline.main: Education Aide to Pennsylvania Governor Resigns Amid Controversy

docs.snippet: A top education consultant to Pennsylvania Governor Tom Corbett resigned on Tuesday amid allegations that he was a so-called ghost employee who did little work for his six-figure salary....
docs.lead_paragraph: A top education consultant to Pennsylvania Governor Tom Corbett resigned on Tuesday amid allegations that he was a so-called ghost employee who did little work for his six-figure salary.
